question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

This would indeed mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Additionally, the movie is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million domestically, which would also be the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. Considering these projections and the fact that the movie will likely play at more theaters than the original Deadpool, it seems likely that the movie will top the record. However, it's worth noting that the resolution of this question depends on the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reporting the movie's opening weekend as the record for an R-rated movie release, which adds a layer of uncertainty.

Historically, geomagnetic storms with Kp indices greater than 4 are not uncommon, especially during periods of high solar activity. However, the probability of such an event occurring during a specific 11-day period is difficult to predict with certainty. To make an informed estimate, we can look at the frequency of geomagnetic storms with Kp indices greater than 4 over the past few years. metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the strongest geomagnetic storm having a K-index ('Kp') greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5 between July 17 and July 28, 2024, we need to consider historical data on geomagnetic storms and their intensity. Geomagnetic storms are caused by changes in the Earth's magnetic field, often triggered by solar activity such as coronal mass ejections (CMEs) or solar flares. The Kp index is a measure of the geomagnetic storm's intensity, ranging from 0 (quiet) to 9 (extreme). According to historical data from the German Research Center for Geosciences, the Kp index typically ranges from 0 to 5, with values above 4 indicating a moderate to strong geomagnetic storm. Given the time frame of July 17 to July 28, 2024, we can expect some level of solar activity, as this period coincides with the summer months in the Northern Hemisphere, when the Earth's magnetic field is more active. However, predicting the exact intensity of geomagnetic storms is challenging, as it depends on various factors, including the timing and intensity of solar flares and CMEs. Assuming a moderate level of solar activity during this period, I estimate that the probability of the strongest geomagnetic storm having a Kp index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5 is around 0.3. This is based on historical data showing that moderate geomagnetic storms (Kp 4-5) are relatively common during periods of moderate solar activity.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The probability of Russian athletes being barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics is difficult to estimate with certainty, as it depends on various factors such as the International Olympic Committee's (IOC) decisions, geopolitical tensions, and the Russian government's actions. However, considering the current situation and past events, I can provide some context and insights. In 2020, Russian athletes competed under the Russian Olympic Committee's flag due to a doping ban imposed by the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA). The IOC has been under pressure to take a stronger stance against Russia's doping program, and there have been calls to ban Russian athletes from competing altogether. However, the IOC has also shown a willingness to allow Russian athletes to compete under certain conditions, such as competing under a neutral flag or with certain restrictions. The IOC's president, Thomas Bach, has stated that the organization wants to find a solution that balances the need to punish Russia for its doping program with the need to allow clean Russian athletes to compete. Given these factors, it's possible that Russian athletes will be allowed to compete at the 2024 Olympics, but with certain restrictions or under a neutral flag. However, it's also possible that the IOC may decide to impose a more severe ban, especially if there are further doping scandals or if geopolitical tensions escalate. Considering the uncertainty and the various factors at play, I would estimate the probability of Russian athletes being barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics as follows:

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. However, the principle itself is straightforward, and a public statement of commitment could be made relatively quickly if there is the will to do so. 5. Verification by Metaculus and Acceptance by righttowarn.ai: The requirement for Metaculus to verify OpenAI's commitment and for it to be satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai adds an additional layer of complexity. This step ensures that any commitment made by OpenAI is taken seriously and is not just a superficial gesture. Considering these factors, while there are valid reasons to believe OpenAI might commit to the principle (alignment with their goals, external pressure, existing culture of openness), the requirement for a new level of commitment, the need for verification, and the short timeframe introduce uncertainty. Therefore, the probability of OpenAI publicly committing to the 'no retaliation for public risk disclosure' principle before July 1, 2024, is not a certainty but is plausible given the right circumstances and decisions.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question revolves around the invocation of Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare President Biden incapacitated before August 2024. This section requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to agree that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office. Given the current political climate and the recent request by a GOP lawmaker for Attorney General Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment, it is possible that there may be attempts to declare President Biden incapacitated. However, it is crucial to consider the high threshold required for the invocation of Section 4, which includes the agreement of the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet. This is a significant political hurdle, and it is unlikely that such a declaration would be made without substantial evidence of the President's incapacitation. Additionally, the question specifies that the declaration must occur before August 2024, which is a relatively short timeframe. While it is possible that events could unfold rapidly, it is also possible that the process of invoking Section 4 could take longer than the remaining time before August. Considering these factors, I estimate the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 as follows:

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Iran initiating a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, we need to consider several factors. First, the current tensions between Iran and Israel have been escalating in recent years, with both countries engaging in a series of proxy wars and covert operations. However, a direct military confrontation between the two nations is a significant escalation that would have far-reaching consequences for the region. Second, Iran has been facing significant economic and political pressure from the United States and its allies, which could potentially push the country to take more aggressive actions. However, it's also possible that Iran might refrain from taking such actions to avoid further escalation and potential retaliation. Third, the time frame specified in the question is relatively short, which reduces the likelihood of a military action being initiated by Iran. Considering these factors, I believe that while there is a possibility of Iran initiating a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, it is not highly likely given the potential consequences and the short time frame.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

The previous polls show a steady increase in the percentage of respondents who believe that weak AGI has been achieved, with 15% in the first poll and 27% in the second poll. This suggests that the respondents' perception of AGI progress is increasing over time. question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question is asking whether Donald Trump will gain at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when running against Joe Biden compared to running against a generic Democrat. The context provided suggests that public opinion polls have consistently shown Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump, while other Democrats have polled ahead or within the margin of error. This implies that Joe Biden may be a weaker candidate compared to other Democrats, which could lead to a higher vote share for Trump when running against him. However, it's also possible that Manifold respondents may not be representative of the general public, which could affect the outcome of the polls. Additionally, the question is asking for a specific margin of 3% or more, which may be a challenging threshold to meet. Given these factors, I would estimate the probability of Trump gaining at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when running against Joe Biden compared to running against a generic Democrat as follows:

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 2% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 2% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.02. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question is asking whether Trump will gain at least 2% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. To answer this, we need to consider the differences in how people perceive Joe Biden versus a generic Democrat. Public opinion polls have consistently shown that Joe Biden performs worse than other Democrats when matched against Trump. This suggests that Biden may have some unique characteristics or baggage that make him less appealing to certain voters. On the other hand, a generic Democrat is a more abstract concept and may not have the same level of negative associations. Given this, it's possible that some voters who might not support Biden due to his specific policies or persona might still support a generic Democrat. When faced with the choice between Trump and Biden, these voters might be more likely to choose Trump, whereas they might choose the generic Democrat in the other poll. However, it's also important to note that Manifold respondents may not be representative of the general public, as hinted in the prompt. If Manifold respondents have different demographics, ideologies, or biases compared to the general public, this could affect the outcome. Considering these factors, I estimate that Trump has a moderate chance of gaining at least 2% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To accurately forecast the geomagnetic storm's K-index, we need to consider historical trends and current solar activity. Unfortunately, I don't have access to real-time data or the ability to fetch current information. However, I can provide general insights based on my training data. Geomagnetic storms with a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 are considered moderate to strong storms. These events are often associated with solar flares, coronal mass ejections (CMEs), or high-speed solar wind streams. Historically, the probability of a geomagnetic storm with a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 occurring within a given 11-day period (July 17-28) is difficult to estimate without current solar activity data. However, we can consider the average frequency of such events. According to the German Research Center for Geosciences, the K-index is measured on a scale from 0 to 9, with higher values indicating stronger geomagnetic storms. A K-index between 5 and 6 is not uncommon, especially during periods of high solar activity. Given the lack of current data, I will rely on general trends. The probability of a geomagnetic storm with a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 occurring within a given 11-day period is likely higher during solar maximum periods and lower during solar minimum periods. question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, I must consider the likelihood of a strong geomagnetic storm occurring between July 17 and July 28, 2024. The Kp index is a measure of geomagnetic activity, with values ranging from 0 to 9. A Kp index greater than 5 indicates a moderate to strong geomagnetic storm. Historically, strong geomagnetic storms are relatively rare, but they can occur during periods of high solar activity, such as during solar flares or coronal mass ejections. The question does not provide any specific information about the current solar activity or forecast, so I will rely on general knowledge of geomagnetic storm frequency. According to the Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC), the probability of a Kp index greater than 5 on any given day is around 10-20%. However, this probability can increase during periods of high solar activity. Given the 11-day time frame (July 17-28, 2024), the probability of at least one day having a Kp index greater than 5 is higher than the daily probability. Assuming independence between days, the probability of at least one day having a Kp index greater than 5 can be estimated using the binomial distribution. Let's assume a daily probability of 15% (a rough estimate between 10-20%). The probability of at least one day having a Kp index greater than 5 in 11 days is: 1 - (probability of no days with Kp > 5)^11 = 1 - (0.85)^11 ≈ 0.67. So, the probability of at least one day having a Kp index greater than 5 between July 17 and July 28, 2024, is approximately 67%.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Nvidia's market capitalization being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, we need to consider several factors, including the current market trends, the companies' financial performance, and the overall industry outlook. Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2025?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2025, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

This reflects a moderate level of uncertainty, acknowledging both the possibility of another lengthy conversation and the relatively short timeframe.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question is asking for the probability that President Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. To assess this probability, we need to consider the likelihood of the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet invoking Section 4 of the 25th Amendment. Firstly, it's important to note that the 25th Amendment is a constitutional provision that allows for the transfer of power to the Vice President if the President is unable to discharge their duties. However, this provision is typically invoked in cases of serious illness, injury, or incapacitation, and not for political reasons. Given the current political climate and the fact that President Biden has not shown any signs of serious illness or incapacitation, it's unlikely that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet would invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment. Additionally, the Cabinet is composed of members appointed by the President, and it's unlikely that they would turn against him. Furthermore, the fact that a GOP lawmaker has asked Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office is not a strong indicator of the likelihood of this event occurring. This is likely a political maneuver rather than a serious attempt to invoke the 25th Amendment. Therefore, based on these considerations, I estimate the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 to be very low.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

metadata.chain_of_thought: This question is asking about the control of Chasiv Yar, a city in eastern Ukraine, on June 1, 2024. The resolution of this question depends on the assessment of the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map, which provides updates on the conflict in Ukraine. To answer this question, I need to consider the current situation in Ukraine, the trends in the conflict, and the likelihood of changes in control over the next few months. As of the current date (April 25, 2024), the conflict in Ukraine is ongoing, with both Ukrainian and Russian forces engaged in various parts of the country. While it is difficult to predict the outcome of the conflict, I can consider some general trends and factors that might influence the control of Chasiv Yar. Firstly, Chasiv Yar is located in the Donetsk Oblast, which has been a contested region throughout the conflict. The city has been under Ukrainian control for most of the war, but there have been periods of intense fighting and changes in control. Secondly, the ISW map provides a snapshot of the situation on the ground, but it may not always reflect the most up-to-date information. The map is updated regularly, but there may be delays or discrepancies in the reporting. Given these factors, I will consider the following scenarios: 1. Russian forces maintain or gain control of Chasiv Yar: This scenario is possible, given the ongoing conflict and the presence of Russian forces in the region. However, it is difficult to predict with certainty whether they will be able to maintain or gain control of the city. 2. Ukrainian forces maintain or regain control of Chasiv Yar: This scenario is also possible, given the Ukrainian military's efforts to defend their territory and the support they receive from international partners. Considering these scenarios, I estimate the probability of Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, as follows: Probability: 0.4. This probability reflects my uncertainty about the outcome, given the ongoing conflict and the factors mentioned above. While it is possible that Russian forces may maintain or gain control of Chasiv Yar, it is also possible that Ukrainian forces may maintain or regain control. The probability of 0.4 indicates that I consider the outcome to be uncertain, with a slight leaning towards Ukrainian control.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the domestic box office opening of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' being higher than that of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine' combined, let's consider several factors: 1. Franchise Growth and Popularity: The popularity of both the Deadpool and Wolverine franchises has grown significantly since the release of the individual movies mentioned. Deadpool (2016) and Logan (2017), the sequel to The Wolverine (2013), both received critical acclaim and performed well at the box office. This growth in popularity could contribute to a higher opening for a combined film. 2. Combined Star Power: The movie brings together two of the most popular characters from the X-Men universe, potentially attracting fans of both franchises. This combined star power could lead to a higher box office draw. 3. Current Market Trends: The box office performance of recent superhero movies has been strong, with many films in the genre achieving high opening weekends. If this trend continues, it could favor a higher opening for 'Deadpool & Wolverine'. 4. Competition and Release Date: The success of the movie's opening weekend can also depend on its release date and the competition it faces. A strategic release date that avoids direct competition with other major blockbusters could help. 5. question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.). This indicates that there is significant opposition to the early nomination plan among Democrats. Furthermore, the fact that a lawmaker involved in the effort has confirmed the existence of a letter and expressed dissatisfaction with the DNC's move suggests that the opposition is not just a small group, but rather a sizable number of Democrats. Given this information, it is likely that at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close on Sunday, July 21st.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question revolves around whether President Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. To assess this probability, we must consider the context and the specific requirements for invoking Section 4. First, Section 4 of the 25th Amendment allows for the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to declare the President unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President the Acting President. This is a significant and formal process that requires substantial evidence of the President's incapacity. Given the current context, there have been calls from some GOP lawmakers for the invocation of the 25th Amendment to remove President Biden from office. However, these calls are largely political and lack the necessary bipartisan support and evidence of incapacitation to trigger Section 4. Moreover, the Cabinet, which would need to support such a declaration by a majority, is appointed by the President and is likely to be loyal to him. Without a significant and undeniable demonstration of the President's inability to perform his duties, it is unlikely that the Cabinet would support such a move. Additionally, the Vice President, who would need to be in agreement with the Cabinet's assessment, has shown no indication of pursuing this course of action. The Vice President's role is to support the President, and without a clear and compelling reason to do otherwise, it is unlikely that they would participate in declaring the President incapacitated. Considering these factors, the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 is low.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: The 25th Amendment Section 4 is a constitutional provision that allows the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to declare the President incapacitated and unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office. This provision is typically invoked in cases where the President is physically or mentally unable to perform their duties, such as due to illness, injury, or incapacitation. In this case, the question is asking whether President Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. While there have been some concerns raised about President Biden's age and health, there is no credible evidence to suggest that he is currently incapacitated or unable to perform his duties as President. Furthermore, invoking the 25th Amendment Section 4 is a serious and rare measure that requires a high level of consensus among the Vice President and the Cabinet. It is unlikely that such a measure would be taken without clear evidence of incapacitation, and it is even more unlikely that it would be taken before August 2024, given the current political climate and the fact that the 2024 presidential election is just around the corner.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

Given the ongoing tensions and the IOC's previous decisions, it is likely that Russian athletes will face some form of restrictions or limitations on their participation in the 2024 Olympics. question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

However, in recent years, there have been efforts to improve relations, including increased trade and investment. Given the current state of relations and the lack of any recent major incidents, it seems unlikely that diplomatic expulsions or recalls will take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024.
